text: Your company culture does not yet support good DevOps practices. However, consulting can help you to improve your culture with little investment.
Your culture already has some features that support good DevOps practices. As culture is one of the one most important factors in DevOps, some consulting may still be necessary.
Your company culture obeys most of the features required in fostering a DevOps-friendly atmosphere. Good job!
Your workflow is still quite old-school, and learning new ways of operating could be of a massive help toward your productivity.
You have already learned some good workflow practices, but a lot can still be improved. Some training could still improve your work.
Most of your workflow practices already implement good DevOps practices.
You have still a lot of learning to do with DevOps tools. Luckily, we have good basic-level courses to help you.
You already use tools needed to embrace a DevOps way of working. However, learning more advanced-level usage of these tools could still help you enormously.
Your tools usage is on a very good level. If you have fewer points from other categories, focusing on improving on them will help you most.
Your skills are still lacking. Consider taking some courses to learn more on skills such as CI/CD configuration and testing frameworks.
Your skills are good. However, there is really no point where skill improvement would no longer benefit, so further training could always improve your work.
Code quality is the basic pre-requisite to transfer to better DevOps practices. Your coding conventions still need improvement, consider improving on this first.
Your coding practices are already pretty good, but learning about how the conventions can be further improved could still help you a lot.
